message.content:
cs.CV, cs.GR, cs.MM, cs.IR, cs.NE 

The paper deals with the problem of capturing high dynamic range scenes using consumer cameras with limited sensor bit depth. This is a problem that is typically addressed in computer vision and graphics, which suggests that the paper belongs to the cs.CV (Computer Vision and Pattern Recognition) sub-category. Additionally, the paper proposes a novel sensor concept and a reconstruction algorithm, which involves image processing and manipulation, suggesting that it could also belong to the cs.GR (Graphics) sub-category. The paper also involves theoretical analysis and optimization, which could place it in the cs.MM (Multimedia) and cs.IR (Information Retrieval) sub-categories. Finally, the paper involves the use of machine learning techniques to address the problem, which could place it in the cs.NE (Neural and Evolutionary Computing) sub-category.
